summary: The Stop Importing Terrorism Act (H.R. 2606) aims to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act. The bill repeals an exception to the terrorism-related ground for inadmissibility. It also makes aliens admitted under the now-repealed exception deportable. The effective time frame for potential deportations extends from January 20, 2021, until the bill's enactment date. The bill is sponsored by Ms. Mace and was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
